revised_title: On the Relations of the Secular Variation of Magnetic Declination and Inclination
tldr: The author investigates the secular variation of magnetic declination and inclination at various locations, including London, Cape of Good Hope, St. Helena, and Ascension Island, using a novel device called the magnetarium. The study reveals that the period of backward rotation of an electro-dynamic substance within the earth's crust is responsible for the observed changes in magnetic elements.
